chapter.chapter_title: Chapter 4, The Reagan Revolution: Repudiations and Deformations

paragraph.paragraph_no: 4.8 "Yet the real culprit behind the fiscal profligacy which descended..."

notes.notes_desc: Successive leadership of all political persuasion are guilty of the same fiscal profligacy which suggests that the system encourages such behavior.

paragraph.paragraph_no: 4.14 "The first spell of false prosperity was the unacknowledged yet..."

notes.notes_desc: The problem with the whole idea of borrowing prosperity from a future generation is that the so-called prosperity is only theoretical. It amounts to the prosperity of more government projects. However, if these projects are in fact inefficient allocations of productive capacity, the result is not only a loss to the future but also a loss in prosperity right now.
